entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy 6: Brave New World (FF6 rom hack) (SNES, 2013) (14)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy 6: Brave New World (FF6 rom hack) (SNES, 2013) (14)20170802
I had a long play session today and got a few things. I beat
Tritoch, got Strago, explored a bit, and tried to get Umaro. I
kept getting creamed over and over by lots of different enemies. I
feel like so many things about this mod are brilliant, but the
WoR, in particular, has been made too hard. It used to be that you
had a lot of options of what you wanted to do at this point, but
I'm finding that either there's a certain order you should go in
or the thing to do is grind a lot. I'm quite annoyed. I don't
think I'll play anymore, unless I just want to do some
time-wasting grinding. It's a bummer, because so much about the
mod is awesome.

Total time: 23:56
  • Video Games
  • Final Fantasy 6: Brave New World (FF6 rom hack)
  • SNES
  • 2013

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 3 - The Queen's Justice
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 3 - The Queen's Justice20170731
It was cute to have Dany and Jon together. I feel like Jon was
awesome and Dany was less than great, but it was great when she
apologized. It was especially good for Tyrion and Jon to catch
up. It was very provocative what Melissandre said! It was awesome
when the dragons flew by!

I think that Yara's men won't care about Theon and probably won't
care about Dany... at best they will want revenge but that
doesn't seem to motivate the Ironborn much.

Euron is so gross, but in a hilarious way. Cersei's way of
dealing with the Martells was so brutal. I was surprised to see
the Iron Bank come, but it was cool.

Sansa was doing a great job and I'm impressed by how good
Littlefinger's advice was. It was awesome to have Bran back and
interesting that he immediately answered the question on my mind,
that he should be the Lord of Winterfell. I'm a bit disappointed
he didn't do anything more and that we didn't see Meera in a new
outfit like we saw Bran.

It's sad that Sam and Jorah didn't talk about the White Walkers,
because when Jorah goes back to Dany it would be useful for him
to support Jon.

The Unsullied, and by extension Dany, are doing really
terribly. The Tyrell's situation made it so much worse. It's sad
how badly Dany is being trounced when it comes to strategy. She's
been so dominant and confident, so she can't deal with a good
threat.

Jaime and Olenna's conversation was great.

I've decided that it would be a bad idea for Arya to travel
north, because all she'll do is talk to her family and then
immediately have to travel all the way back south. She's the best
weapon of the Starks against Cersei, when they will otherwise be
facing the White Walkers. I suppose she could be a good support
against Littlefinger when he inevitably betrays them.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Movie: Shin Godzilla, by Toho (2016)
entry.content:
Movie: Shin Godzilla, by Toho (2016)20170730
This was very clever. I like how it is poking fun at Japanese
bureaucracy. I thought that Godzilla's eyes looked really weird and
bizarre, but otherwise the models were cool.

This review is great: ``In his review, Ollie Barder stated, "In
many ways, this new movie is a searing indictment of how the 2011
Tohoku earthquake and tsunami as well as the Fukushima disaster
were mishandled by the Japanese administration." He also noted the
film's depiction of the Japanese government, stating, "In that, the
old guard with their overly complex and corpulent bureaucratic ways
were simply unable to deal with a crisis in any kind of efficient
or fluid way. This is shown repeatedly in Resurgence, as the
high-ranking members of the cabinet, comfortable in their positions
of power, use the hierarchical nature of the system they reside
within to protect their own positions, at the expense of the lives
of their citizens."''
  • Movies
  • 2016
